data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Capture of Carbon Dioxide from Air and Flue Gas in the Alkylamine-Appended Metal–Organic Framework mmen-Mg2(dobpdc)

data.question: Who are the authors of the article?
data.answer: Thomas M. McDonald, Woo Ram Lee, Jarad A. Mason, Brian M. Wiers, Chang Seop Hong, and Jeffrey R. Long

data.question: What is the DOI of the article?
What are the two new metal–organic frameworks mentioned in the article?
What is the exceptional capacity of mmen-Mg2(dobpdc) for CO2 adsorption at low pressures?
What is the estimated regeneration energy for mmen-Mg2(dobpdc) as a flue gas adsorbent?
What is the role of coordinatively unsaturated Mg2+ cations in mmen-Mg2(dobpdc)?
data.answer: They were functionalized with N,N′-dimethylethylenediamine (mmen) to afford mmen-Mg2(dobpdc).

data.question: What is the purity of CO2 removed from dry air using mmen-Mg2(dobpdc)?
Is mmen-Mg2(dobpdc) capable of being regenerated upon repeated exposures to simulated air and flue gas mixtures?
Does the article suggest that mmen-Mg2(dobpdc) compares favorably with both amine-grafted silicas and aqueous amine solutions for CO2 capture?
Is the BET surface area of mmen-Mg2(dobpdc) significantly greater than that of Mg2(dobdc)?
Does the article provide evidence that mmen-Mg2(dobpdc) is an exceptional adsorbent for CO2 capture from air?

Does the article claim that mmen-Mg2(dobpdc) has a lower heat capacity than MEA solutions?
According to the article, does the presence of water in gas mixtures significantly affect the stability, capacity, selectivity, or regeneration energy of mmen-Mg2(dobpdc)?
What is the BET surface area of activated Mg2(dobpdc) according to the article?
What is the estimated purity of CO2 removed from flue gas using mmen-Mg2(dobpdc)?
What is the role of DEF in the synthesis of DEF-Mg2(dobpdc)?
data.answer: DEF acts as a solvent in the synthesis process.

data.question: Does the article indicate that the CO2 adsorption capacity of mmen-Mg2(dobpdc) decreases at higher pressures?
